choices: Efficient and fast, Concurrency support, Garbage collection, Static typing, Simple syntax, Built-in testing and benchmarking, Cross-platform support

There is no significant difference between Go and other programming languages
Go is a low-level language with direct memory access and manual memory management
A named storage location that holds a value of a specific type
A reusable block of code that performs a specific task
A collection of Go source files that are compiled together
A dynamically-sized, flexible view into the elements of an array
An ordered collection of items that cannot be changed
A user-defined composite type that contains named fields
An ordered collection of items that can be changed
A control flow statement that allows code to be executed repeatedly
